title: atlas motion under bdi control does not perform the same under different real time factor

content.raw:
I ran the following scripted motion, (see below,using a modified Keyboard Teleop)
Atlas completes this without falling when using : atlas_utils atlas.launch
Atlas always loses balance when using : atlas_utils qual_task_1.launch

The only difference I could find in the parameters of the model was that the surface friction on the platforms was different that than the friction of the ground plane.  However, I also ran atlas on the ground plane of qual_task_1, with the same problem.

The other difference is that the atlas.launch simulation is running at: .32 real time factor, and the qual_task_1 is running at .18 (which is why I was running tests on the simpler world).  I would not think that running at a slower real time factor should effect the physics.

~~~
(x, y, theta, step number)
Walking Step Data 7 steps
foot: 0 [0.0, 0.1, 0.0, 0]
foot: 0 [0.25, 0.25, 0.0, 1]
foot: 1 [0.3658455931, 0.1688840425, 0.1745329252, 2]
foot: 0 [0.5152637125, 0.4893122335, 0.3490658504, 3]
foot: 1 [0.6434349889, 0.4295449858, 0.3490658504, 4]
foot: 0 [0.8462248827, 0.7191589685, 0.1745329252, 5]
foot: 1 [0.9462248827, 0.5191589685, 0.0, 6]
foot: 0 [0.9962248827, 0.6191589685, 0.0, 7]
now publish Stand
~~~
content.html:
I ran the following scripted motion, (see below,using a modified Keyboard Teleop) Atlas completes this without falling when using : atlas_utils atlas.launch Atlas always loses balance when using : atlas_utils qual_task_1.launch

The only difference I could find in the parameters of the model was that the surface friction on the platforms was different that than the friction of the ground plane. However, I also ran atlas on the ground plane of qual_task_1, with the same problem.

The other difference is that the atlas.launch simulation is running at: .32 real time factor, and the qual_task_1 is running at .18 (which is why I was running tests on the simpler world). I would not think that running at a slower real time factor should effect the physics.
